label.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a piece of paper or another material that is attached to something and gives information about it
label.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: It says ‘Dry clean’ on the label.
label.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a word or phrase which is used to describe a person, group, or thing, but which is unfair or not correct
label.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Men these days have to avoid attracting the ‘sexist’ label.
label.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: their new release on the Ace Sounds label
label.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to attach a label onto something or write information on something
label.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Each bag of seeds is labelled with the grower’s name.
label.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to use a word or phrase to describe someone or something, but often unfairly or incorrectly
label.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The newspapers had unjustly labelled him a troublemaker.
The regime was inevitably labelled as ‘communist’.
label.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a piece of paper or cloth that is attached to something and gives information about it
label.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: price labels on goods in a supermarket
Read the label carefully and follow the instructions exactly.
label.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: the company or brand name on a product
label.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Some retailers market some goods under their own branding and some under the manufacturer’s label.
label.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: the name of a record company
label.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: Phillips’ Polygram record company bought the Island label.
label.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: the name of a wine-making company
label.translation[2].definitions[3].exam: This wine from the Napa Ridge label is one of the great bargains of all time.
label.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to fix a label onto something or write a description on something
label.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Beef producers must obey certain rules in labeling their new low-fat products.
All charts, diagrams and tables should be labelled.
The government forced six companies to stop labeling their processed pastas, juices and pickles as ‘fresh.’
label.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to use a word or phrase to describe someone or something, often unfairly or incorrectly
label.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: One of the things we tend to do in organizations, unfortunately, is label people.
Plastics aren’t perceived as recyclable and so are labelled as environmentally unfriendly.
